avalancheActivity.highlights: A lot of snow has drifted from the area. Wind slabs have formed in the mountains after SW-snow showers and strong winds. Becoming warmer with considereble rain on Thursday to Friday and the snowcover can become unstable to begin with.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow is covering the region but much has drifted away. Wind slabs have formed on N- and E- facing aspects. Snowprofile was taken in Bláfjöll 30th of Jan in NW facing aspect. The profile showed layers of hard windslabs with layers of hail in between.  Extended stability test gave fracture at high stress, (ECTN26 @80cm).  Ongoing snow fall and westerly winds will continue forming wind slabs and cornices in the mountains.  Becoming warmer with considereble rain on Thursday to Friday and the snowcover can become unstable to begin with. The snowcover is expected to become stable with cooling temperatures.

travelAdvisory.comment: New wind slabs have formed in most parts during SW snow showers in the last days. Most precipitation has been in South- and West parts but little snow was present before. Warming last week in all regions made the snowpack uniform and isothermal, notably in North Iceland where a persistent weakness was widespread and may still be found at high elevations.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. Ongoing SW directions in the next days and snowfall continue forming wind slabs on N and E aspects. Temporary thaw on Friday.

weatherForecast.highlights: Dimm él og vestlæg átt 15-23 á miðvikudag. S-læg átt með éljum eða skúrum á fimmtudag, færist í austan og tekur að hlýna með rigningu fram á föstudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalnches fell on Súðavíkurhlíð evening of 30th of jan. Many avalanches, most of them small, released in the area during and after heavy but short snowfall and snowdrift on early Thursday 25 January.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Unstable windslabs have built up in W to E facing aspects. Strong NW to NE winds in Wednesday and windslabs are expected to form in southerly facing aspects and can be unstable.

snowpackStructure.highlights: During the last week, snow has added and drifted in variable wind, especially SW. Before, there was little snow in the area. The night before Thursday, it snowed heavily for a while, first in NE directions, then in E and SW directions. As a result, many small avalanches released in the forecast area, on slopes facing various directions. Now there is considerable new snow in the area and continuing snow showers in variable southerly winds are forecasted. Wind slabs are expected to have formed and should continue to build up the next days, especially in gullies, depressions and slopes facing W-N-E. NW to NE winds on Wednesday is expected to form unstable windslabs in southerly facing aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: New wind slabs have formed in most parts during SW snow showers in the last days. Most precipitation has been in South- and West parts but little snow was present before. Warming last week in all regions made the snowpack uniform and isothermal, notably in North Iceland where a persistent weakness was widespread and may still be found at high elevations.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. Ongoing SW directions in the next days and snowfall continue forming wind slabs on N and E aspects. Temporary thaw on Friday.

weatherForecast.highlights: Breytileg en svo norðlægari átt á miðvikudag með éljum. Suðlægar eða breytilegar áttir á fimmtudag og hlýnar heldur.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few avalanches occurred last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Windslabs are present, especially on N-E aspects. Weak layers could be present in the snowpack. Rain on Friday with chances of wet avalanches.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Windslabs are present, especially on N-E aspects after SW winds. Further windslab formation is likely in the next few days during SW/W winds. Snowpit from Siglufjarðarskarð on Jan 29 showed weak layers on 18 cm and 30 cm. A persistent weak layer could still be present at very high elevations. Rain is forecasted on Friday at low elevations, which could cause wet avalanches.

travelAdvisory.comment: New wind slabs have formed in most parts during SW snow showers in the last days. Most precipitation has been in South- and West parts but little snow was present before. Warming last week in all regions made the snowpack uniform and isothermal, notably in North Iceland where a persistent weakness was widespread and may still be found at high elevations.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. Ongoing SW directions in the next days and snowfall continue forming wind slabs on N and E aspects. Temporary thaw on Friday.

weatherForecast.highlights: Áframhaldandi SV/V-læg átt og él. Hlýnar á fimmtudag og aðfaranótt föstudags er útlit fyrir rigningu í hægum vindi en snjókomu hátt til fjalla. Kólnar fljótt og snýst aftur í SV-læga átt.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few small avalanches occurred in Norðfjörður on Jan 27. A small sluff occurred above Neskaupstaður on Jan 25.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The snow thawed a bit on Monday. Thin windslabs were present, mainly on N-E aspects. Chances of wet avalanches on Friday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snow thawed a bit on Monday evening. Thin windslabs had most likely formed on N-E aspects. Some snow will be added on Tuesday, which could drift on easterly aspects. Friday looks like rain up to 700 m.a.s.l., which could cause wet avalanches.

travelAdvisory.comment: New wind slabs have formed in most parts during SW snow showers in the last days. Most precipitation has been in South- and West parts but little snow was present before. Warming last week in all regions made the snowpack uniform and isothermal, notably in North Iceland where a persistent weakness was widespread and may still be found at high elevations.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. Ongoing SW directions in the next days and snowfall continue forming wind slabs on N and E aspects. Temporary thaw on Friday.

weatherForecast.highlights: Vestlægar áttir og dálítil snjókoma. Hlýnar á fimmtudag. Á föstudag gengur lægð yfir landið með rigningu, en snjókomu mjög hátt til fjalla.
